newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Rouble firms on T-bill buying, client demand.
newsitem.headline: Rouble firms on T-bill buying, client demand.

text.p: The rouble edged up on Tuesday as banks sought funds to invest in government securities and to make other payments, dealers said.
roubles/dollar Jun 10 midday Jun 10 early Jun 9 close
"Banks were selling dollars ahead of the T-bill auctions and for other purposes which one can only guess," CS First Boston dealer Sergei Koshelenko said.
The Finance Ministry will auction 9.00 trillion roubles of 105-day GKO discount Treasury bills and 5.50 trillion roubles of 364-day bills on June 11.
"On Wednesday rouble supply is likely to grow now that the dollar is near the lower limit of the central bank rates and banks can sell dollars to it," he added.
The central bank usually intervenes on the interbank market at its daily rates.
Aljba Alliance Bank chief dealer Dmitry Slobodnik said the rouble had firmed also on bank client demand.
The rouble has steadied in recent weeks on purchases by large corporations, including gas monopoly Gazprom, which are trying to pay off tax arrears.
